column3:
linter failure:

```
CHECK_NONFATAL(condition) should be used instead of assert for RPC code.
src/rpc/util.cpp:649:            assert(!m_inner.empty());
```

Not sure if this is needed. The resulting doc is not JSON that you can copy paste into a JSON parser. Stuff like `...` or `n` or `true|false` isn't valid JSON either.

This is the rendered diff on my end:

```diff
diff --git a/getblockstats b/getblockstats
index cff3f22..11fbf07 100644
--- a/getblockstats
+++ b/getblockstats
@@ -23,7 +23,7 @@ Result:
     n,
#8501 uses it to transfer a potentially large data set of statistical samples.
Fair enough. Though, I still think that the output is primarily for documentation purposes and not to please an imaginary JSON language lawyer
Concept ACK, not a bugfix IMO.
If people want to do this, then it should also be done for fixed-size dicts
Extended it to handle JSON Objects
Concept ACK, not a bugfix, but certainly a mild improvement.

Btw, this is the rendered diff:

<details><summary>diff</summary>

```diff
diff --git a/addmultisigaddress b/addmultisigaddress
index d061704..10fb22b 100644
--- a/addmultisigaddress
+++ b/addmultisigaddress
@@ -19,8 +19,8 @@ Arguments:
 Result:
 {                            (json object)
   "address" : "str",         (string) The value of the new multisig address
   "red
